    • Method Detail

      • internalPlayer

        IMediaPlayer internalPlayer()
        Get a internal mediaPlayer 
           Player run core by internal maintaining mediaPlayer.
   In general is not recommended unless you want to operate some special functions.
   * note that internalPlayer and Player
   * at the same time operating possible when the incompatibilities

      • seekTo

        boolean seekTo(long ms,
               int processingLevel)
        Support custom processing level of seekTo
        Parameters:
        processingLevel - The greater the level with processing the more things
        • 1: Callback IPlayer.Listener.onPlayProgress(long, long)
        • 2: Call calibrateCurrentPositionUnitIndex(long)

      • seekTo

        boolean seekTo(long ms)
        internal call seekTo(long, int) Max processing level
        Specified by:
        seekTo in interface IPlayerBase

      • fastForwardRewind

        boolean fastForwardRewind(long ms)
        Parameters:
        ms - fastForwardMs/RewindMs
        • +ms: fastForward

          .fastForwardRewind(1000)->fast forward 1 second

        • -ms: RewindMs

          .fastForwardRewind(-1000)->rewind 1 second

        • shouldAutoPlayWhenSeekComplete

          P shouldAutoPlayWhenSeekComplete(boolean shouldAutoPlayWhenSeekComplete)
          Generally used in front of the seekTo...(.) to ensure that seek complete to auto play immediately after 
             *IPlayerBase.start() method with shouldAutoPlayWhenSeekComplete(true)
   *IPlayerBase.pause() with shouldAutoPlayWhenSeekComplete(false)

        • seekToPending

          void seekToPending(long ms)
          set a pending seekTo in before start() dispose

        • seekToProgress

          long seekToProgress(int progress,
                    int progressMax)
          Seeks to specified progress
          Parameters:
          progress - current progress
          progressMax - the upper limit of this progress range.
          Returns:
          seekTo position (>=0), or -1 if seekTo Failure.

        • setUpdatePlayProgressDelayMs

          P setUpdatePlayProgressDelayMs(long updatePlayProgressDelayMs)
          Sets the updatePlayProgress delay.

          More accurate to handle progress type work.

          • setAB(long, long)

          • IPlayer.Listener.onPositionUnitProgress(long, int, int)
          • ......
            Parameters:
            updatePlayProgressDelayMs - value>=0?value:default[1000 - (position % 1000)]

          • getCurrentMediaId

            java.lang.String getCurrentMediaId()

          • setEnabledWifiLock

            P setEnabledWifiLock(boolean enabled)
            Set enabled wifi lock, to hold a Wifi lock, which prevents the player from going to sleep while the media is playing.

            RequiresPermission(Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK)

            AndroidManifest.xml add below 

             <!--Using a WifiLock For KMedia Player-->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK"/>

          • setEnabledAudioFocusManage

            P setEnabledAudioFocusManage(boolean enabled)

            Parameters:
            posUnitList - [Position Unit] List

          • getCurrentPositionUnitIndex

            int getCurrentPositionUnitIndex()
            Returns:
            current position unit index OR -1(unset | waiting state)

          • setCurrentPositionUnitIndex

            void setCurrentPositionUnitIndex(int posUnitIndex)
            generally not use(player inside Will automatically maintain current [position unit] index)

            If you want to calibrate,can call calibrateCurrentPositionUnitIndex(long)

          • seekToPositionUnitIndex

            long seekToPositionUnitIndex(int posUnitIndex)
            Seeks to specified PositionUnitIndex
            Returns:
            seekTo position (>=0), or -1 if seekTo Failure.

          • calibrateCurrentPositionUnitIndex

            int calibrateCurrentPositionUnitIndex(long position)
            generally not use(player inside Will automatically maintain current [position unit] index calibrate)
            Parameters:
            position - currentPosition or -1[position < 0 || position > getDuration()] (auto getCurrentPosition())
            Returns:
            calibrated PositionUnitIndex or -1(not calibrate or calibrate result not present)

          • setEnabledPositionUnitLoop

            P setEnabledPositionUnitLoop(boolean enabled,
                             int loopMode,
                             int loopInterval)
            Set the enabled,loopMode,loopInterval of this position unit loop, with reset position unit looped count tag

            *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_ORIGINAL keeping the original values

            *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_UNSET/C.PARAM_RESET unset/reset values

            Parameters:
            enabled - True [position unit] loop is enabled, false otherwise.
            loopMode - [Position unit] loop mode
            • -1 disable
            • -8 infinity loop
            • 0++ specified loop
              loopInterval - [Position unit] loop interval
              See Also:
              setUpdatePlayProgressDelayMs(long)

            • setPositionUnitLoopIndexList

              P setPositionUnitLoopIndexList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> posUnitLoopIndexList)
              WARNING: media source change with specify to loop of [position unit] index list will be reset
              Parameters:
              posUnitLoopIndexList - specify to loop of [position unit] index list

            • setAB

              P setAB(long startPos,
        long endPos)
              Set A-B start position and end position with reset ab all tag
              Parameters:
              startPos - [A-B] start position (Ms)
              endPos - [A-B] end position (Ms)
              Returns:
              IPlayer !setAB but does not play. You must call play(?) to play.
              See Also:
              play(), play(Uri)

            • setABLoop

              P setABLoop(int loopMode,
            int loopInterval)
              Set A-B loop

              *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_ORIGINAL keeping the original values

              *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_UNSET/C.PARAM_RESET unset/reset values

              Parameters:
              loopMode - [A-B] loop mode
              • -1 disable
              • -8 infinity loop
              • 0++ specified loop
                loopInterval - [A-B] loop interval (S)
                Returns:
                IPlayer !setAB but does not play. You must call play(?) to play.
                See Also:
                play(), play(Uri)

              • setAB

                P setAB(long startPos,
        long endPos,
        int loopMode,
        int loopInterval)
                Set A-B internal call setAB(long, long), setABLoop(int, int)

                *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_ORIGINAL keeping the original values

                *param loopMode,loopInterval can use C.PARAM_UNSET/C.PARAM_RESET unset/reset values

                Parameters:
                startPos - [A-B] start position (Ms)
                endPos - [A-B] end position (Ms)
                loopMode - [A-B] loop mode
                • -1 disable
                • -8 infinity loop
                • 0++ specified loop
                  loopInterval - [A-B] loop interval (S)
                  Returns:
                  IPlayer !setAB but does not play. You must call play(?) to play.
                  See Also:
                  play(), play(Uri)

                • setClearAB

                  P setClearAB(boolean autoClear)
                  Set auto clear A-B all tag(when A-B finish)

                  WARNING: If for special reasons cause A-B is not finish, will don't auto clear.

                  See Also:
                  clearAB()

                • clearAB

                  void clearAB()
                  Clear A-B all tag

                  Tips: setClearAB(false) also don't manual invoke clearAB(), will save all tag. invoke again play(?) continue play A-B for specified ab tag.

                  See Also:
                  setClearAB(boolean)

                • setMediaQueue

                  void setMediaQueue(IMediaQueue mediaQueue)
                  set a new media queue for player
                  Parameters:
                  mediaQueue - IMediaQueue

                • getMediaQueue

                  IMediaQueue getMediaQueue()
                  get a media queue, if not setMediaQueue(IMediaQueue), it return default media queue
                  Returns:
                  IMediaQueue

                  • removeListener

                    void removeListener(IPlayer.Listener listener)
                    Parameters:
                    listener - param==null -> clear()
